column4: Hey guys. I think I might have accidentally blanked my $PATH variable: Full console dump and explanation here for readability's sake: http://paste.ubuntu.com/577436/
Any help would not only be appreciated, but may also prevent heart attack.
get rid of the . in /etc/profile too
yeah, unless that's really what you want...?
yeah, that's likely not what you want.
standard place to do this is /etc/environment, not /etc/profile
on ubuntu, that's where the PATH is set.  What you have done will work, but just use /etc/environment
Ah, I see. Thanks - I was wondering why there was no PATH in profile. Is this a recent change?
yeah, it was introduced at some point.  Can't remember exactly when, but probably around 8.04
Yeah, that'd be it. Lookin' at old posts and stuff.
you should figure out what's putting that ./usr/local/bin in your path
Yeah, I'll check it in a few days and Whoooooah.
Found the problem. It was actually Nautilus Elementary not inheriting the $PATH variable. Of course, I now learn that the project is dead and that they've moved on to greater things.
I guess that's a good bit of trivia if someone else as silly as myself comes running this way.
